  • Method Details

    • exprEquals

      public abstract boolean exprEquals(Expression other)
      Indicates whether some other expression is equal to this one. Two expressions are the same if and only if they are the same object or structurally constitute the same expression tree up to associativity.
      Parameters:
      other - the expression with which to compare
      Returns:
      true, if object is Expression and is equal to this one.
      See Also:
      • equals(Object)

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this expression. Two expressions are the same if and only if they are the same object or structurally constitute the same expression tree up to associativity.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - the reference object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true, if object is Expression and is equal to this one.
      See Also:
      • exprEquals(Expression)

      public abstract Expression simplify()

      Returns:
